skillTree.localised_description: Commandeered as a rider-less warhorse of a slain Knight, Suleman boldly charges Repanse into battle at the apex of her feared lance formation.

effects.description:
Passive Ability: "For the King! Charge", while this Mount is equipped, for Cavalry units
	(all units in army)

Passive Ability: "For the King! Charge" for Cavalry units
	(all units in army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
Witnessing friendly units with the Peasant Attribute rout will not affect this unit's leadership.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Led by noble example, peasants fight longer and harder lest their Lord be dishonoured.
Thorough drilling increases the peasants' chances of withstanding the horrors of battle.
From the verdant depths, the Lady rises to protect the faithful.
Like the lion, this one is the biggest and the bravest of his kind... with the sharpest teeth.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Knights, peasants, and everyone in between feel honour-bound to follow Repanse to death or glory.

effects.description:

	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +5 for infantry units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: “The Undead scourge must be destroyed. The Lady hath spoken.”

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: In the eyes of the brave, danger gleams like sunshine.
"Toss down your blade and pick up the plough, these lands are ours now!"

effects.description:
Construction cost: -25% for all buildings
	(local region)

Construction time: -50% for all buildings
	(local region)

skillTree.localised_description: Honour and purity are the wings with which the righteous soar above their peers.
If you wish to find an enemy, you need merely throw a stone.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

skillTree.localised_description: This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
When everything else fails, there is always studying the blade. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Wielding the shield is better than returning on it. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Even stupid peasants can learn to stand fast and brace against the charge.

skillTree.localised_description: Many Bretonnian veterans speak of a soothing presence felt on occasion in the heat of battle, helping them to find their mark and keep their cool.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
As an expert in such matters, it is their duty to know the king's law and to mete justice in his name.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
The Lord is entitled to collect tithes from tenants in return for continued protection.
They've seen the Lady's acts or witnessed her blessed grace.
Those whom the Lady has blessed fight with an unquenchable, almost super-human zeal, for they know that she sees them.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: "The land from here to the sea is yours, if you enforce the king's will."
The knowledge that they fight in the king's name, with his support, steels an army for the privations of the siege.
This being must be touched by Tzeentch, seeing things before they happen.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +8%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: Lords must not be concerned with the collecting of taxes; there are others whose lot it is to feel the people's scorn.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
Witnessing friendly units with the Peasant Attribute rout will not affect this unit's leadership.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

factionEffects.localised_description: All assembled were willing to follow the banner of Repanse de Lyonesse, regardless of the peril. They did so because they were the sons of the dukedom of Lyonesse, and like the young Knights Errant, were convinced that the spirit of the Lady herself moved within Repanse and gave them holy purpose on the battlefield.

effects.description: Attrition: -15% casualties suffered from Vampiric territory attrition
Casualty replenishment rate: +8% for non-Knight units
Melee attack: +5 for Foot Squire units
Melee attack: +5 for Spearmen-at-Arms, Men-at-Arms (Polearms) and Mounted Yeomen units
Weapon strength: +5% for Foot Squire units
Weapon strength: +5% for Spearmen-at-Arms, Men-at-Arms (Polearms) and Mounted Yeomen units
Physical resistance: 5% for all Peasant units
Diplomatic relations: -80 with Vampire Counts, Vampire Coast and Tomb Kings

items.colour_text: When first she faced Chaos, Repanse broke open the reliquary of the village Grail Chapel and took up the ancient sword she found there.
A symbol of ancient, holy significance, the magical lily only grows where the Lady appears, and is carried to war as sign of Her warriors' devotion.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: To the smallfolk of Bretonnia, Repanse is their champion – a beacon of hope in what would otherwise be lives of hopeless, downtrodden drudgery.

effects.description: Physical resistance: 5% for all Peasant units

ui_effects.localised_text: Explosion does not affect friendly troops
